snippet: The small town of Hammond has made an annual llama-racing event into a quirky tourist draw, now in its 18th year.
abstract: Annual llama-racing event in Hammond, Wis, has become quirky draw for tourists; race, now in its 18th year, was started in small town of 1,900 residents when local bar owner let animals loose; residents say it is fun, unique attraction, highlighting best of small town life.
lead_paragraph: The small town of Hammond has made an annual llama-racing event into a quirky tourist draw, now in its 18th year.

headline.seo: Wisconsin Town Races Llamas to Draw Crowds
headline.main: This Isn’t Churchill Downs, and Those Aren’t Horses
headline.print_headline: This Isn’t Churchill Downs, and Those Aren’t Horses
